sense.name: measure of intensity of light per unit area
sense.commentary: ILLUMINATION[+quantity][+intensity][+light][+unit][+area] Note: how much light is present, how bright it is. Note: refers to an amount, not an act (Sense 3)
sense.examples: Operating rooms must provide high levels of illumination. What is the illumination produced by a candle? You can control the illumination of the chandelier with a slider on the wall.

sense.name: a conceptual clarification
sense.commentary: ILLUMINATION[+action][+communication][+clarification][+conceptual] Note: implies X clarifies Y for Z Note: nominalization - his illumination of it -> he illuminated it
sense.examples: This article provides some illumination on the origins of the conflict. John's slides were confusing and did not provide illumination of his main points. The professor's illumination helped them understand the textbook.

sense.name: the act of lighting something, making it visible
sense.commentary: ILLUMINATION[+action][+make_visible] Note: nominalization 'his illumination of the stage with red lights -> he illuminated the stage with red lights
sense.examples: The illumination of the stage in red light was quite dramatic. We enjoyed the illumination of the statues at night in the public gardens.

sense.name: spiritual awareness
sense.examples: The hermit experienced a sudden moment of illumination on the mountain top. The book describes the guru's path to illumination.

sense.name: the painted illustrations in medieval books
sense.commentary: ILLUMINATION[+entity][+artifact][+illustration][+manuscript][+medieval] Note: refers to the actual pictures
sense.examples: The illuminations in these 13th-century manuscripts include a lot of gold leaf. The museum has the book open to a very famous illumination by a medieval illustrator.

sense.name: the act of adding decorative illustrations to books
sense.commentary: ILLUMINATION[+action][+illustrating][+decorative][+book] Note: nominalization - his illumination of the manuscript -> he illuminated the manuscript
sense.examples: The illumination of these medieval manuscripts was a time-consuming process. Mary studied illumination in her art history class.

sense.name: lights added for display on buildings
sense.commentary: ILLUMINATION[+entity][+artifact][+lights][+display][+building] Note: always occurs in the plural. Note: refers to the objects/sources of the light.
sense.examples: The new office building has two rows of blue illuminations near the top of the structure. The illuminations on the columns of that mansion look a bit tacky.
